intro: Geonoma saramaccana, commonly known as the Saramacca fern, is a species of flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Bromeliaceae, which includes many epiphytic and terrestrial plants. The plant is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that form a dense, water-holding structure. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, often emerging from the leaf axils. Geonoma saramaccana plays a vital role in its ecosystem by providing habitat and moisture retention in the humid forest understory.
